poem:
**Borders and Blueprints**

In the morning paper,  
a country wonders why  
a distant, stricter neighbor  
measures gates and entry.  
Blueprints unfold  
like maps on the table—  
pencil lines tighten,  
a world reshaped.  
As we sip our tea,  
a question drifts:  
who walks the road  
beneath a shared sky,  
and who builds fences  
to keep the sky still?
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Why does UK government want to copy Denmark’s immigration system? The UK government is expected to announce changes to the country’s immigration rules, modelled on a controversial system used in Denmark which is widely seen as one of the most stringent in Europe. Why does the UK government want to change its immigration system? Concerns about immigration have risen steadily over the past five years, fuelled in part by the number of migrants arriving in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
